result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G. Baley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael G. Baley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael G. Baley was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:30  Defendant Michael G. Baley in court with Attorney Nicholas John Rifelj.  ADA Crystal Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information and Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  Factual basis:  complaint.  Defendant pled Guilty to Count 2 of Amended Information; dismissed Count 1.  Court found defendant guilty on Count 2 and entered JOC.  Sentence:  30 days jail, with huber, may be served in Sauk County; $443 fine/costs, payable in 60 days or payment plan; jail report date on 4-26-15 @ 7:00pm; no jail credit.  9:35

scheduling order
Jury trial on April 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael G. Baley in court with attorney Nicholas J Rifelj.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Defendant Michael G. Baley in court with attorney Nicholas J Rifelj.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State called Cory Otto, former Col. Cty. Deputy, sworn in. Direct examination by ADA Long. Witness identifies defendant. Cross examination by Atty. Rifelj. Certified Judgment marked Exh. 1, moved and received. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.

Defendant Michael G. Baley in court with attorney Nicholas J Rifelj.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not resolved.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Michael G. Baley, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, waives time limits to prelim  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 01:40 pm.  Hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
